definition: to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
variant of 肏[cao4]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious

sentences.english: Now, let's think this over. Let's not go off at half-cocked .
sentences.chinese: 讓我們仔細考慮一下這件事吧，不可操之過急。

sentences.english: First, must correct the manner, everything cannot act with undue haste, is weaned is also same.
sentences.chinese: 首先，要端正態度，凡事不能操之過急，斷奶也一樣。

sentences.english: I think he is being too hasty.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他有些操之過急。

sentences.english: Scientists have determined it's not advisable to hurry marriage.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們建議，結婚也不可以操之過急。

sentences.english: Attempts to blame England's recent riots on youth unemployment were overhasty.
sentences.chinese: 對最近英國無業青年暴亂的譴責似乎操之過急了。

sentences.english: A commander mustn't get too anxious for the sake of some partial advantage.
sentences.chinese: 一個指揮員不要因爲局部利益操之過急。

sentences.english: But cannot act too hastily, and should perserve.
sentences.chinese: 但不可操之過急，而應持之以恆。

sentences.english: However, patience should be needed during its operation in case new hidden ganger would be left.
sentences.chinese: 但對待該問題也不能操之過急，以免留下新的隱患。

definition: extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
to be stuck/to feel stuck
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to force someone to do something
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
readily following good advice (idiom); willing to accept other people's views
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to squander money/to spend extravagantly
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
